page.title: 12Closing Of Wickham School
page.content: Wickham St.Paul's school was built in 1852 for sixty pupils.At the turn of the century there were over a hundred children.When Miss Warren,who we interviewed,attended fifty years ago there were fifty children but when the school closed in December 1983 there were only eight. There used to be more houses because each cottage was smaller and had more children. Nowadays housing is expensive, and many people educate their children at private schools.The school building was the same as it is now. There are two classrooms - one big room and one at the back for the infants. The closure of the school could mean young married couples won't move into the village.The elderly miss watching the children playing on the green, and feel sad that the school is no longer part of the village.
